org.lenskit.util.io

Class GroupingObjectStream<C,E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lenskit.util.io.AbstractObjectStream<C>
      • org.lenskit.util.io.GroupingObjectStream<C,E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<C>, ObjectStream<C>

    public abstract class GroupingObjectStream<C,E>
extends AbstractObjectStream<C>

    Base class for streams that group the output of another stream.

    Since:
    2.1

      • clearGroup

        protected abstract void clearGroup()

        Clear the accumulated group. Called by close().

      • handleItem

        protected abstract boolean handleItem(@Nonnull
                                      E item)

        Handle an item from the base stream. Each item of the base stream is passed to this method. The method builds up the underlying aggregate.

        Parameters:
        item - The item to handle.
        Returns:
        true if the item has been accepted and added to the group; false if it cannot be added to the current group. If it cannot be added to the current group, the stream will call finishGroup() to finish the group, and then call this method again with item (at which point it is required to return true).

      • finishGroup

        @Nonnull
protected abstract C finishGroup()

        Finish the current group and return it. After this method has been called, #handleItem(E) should add items to a new group. This method will not be called unless #handleItem(E) has been called at least once since the last group was finished.

        Returns:
        The group that has been finished.
